Job Position: Executive Secretary

Job Location:&nbsp;Onitsha, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Our client is seeking an intelligent, resourceful, and proactive young woman to join the team as an Executive Secretary to directly support the Managing Director (MD).
	The ideal candidate will be highly organized, detail-oriented, and capable of handling a wide variety of administrative tasks in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide high-level administrative support to the Managing Director.
	Organize and schedule meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements for the MD.
	Draft, review, and send communications on behalf of the MD.
	Prepare and manage reports, presentations, and documents for internal and external meetings.
	Liaise with internal departments and external stakeholders on behalf of the MD.
	Assist in the management of office operations and general administrative functions


Requirements


	Minimum of HND or BSc in Office Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	3-4 years of relevant experience in an executive secretarial role or office management. Previous experience working directly with top executives is a plus.
	Strong proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
	Must be based in Onitsha or willing to relocate.


Salary
N130,000 - N180,000 Monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;info@transtellgroup.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

        Transtell Ventures Nigeria Limited -  Our client, a leading FMCG company located in Onitsha, Anambra State, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Secretary

Job Location: Onitsha, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Our client is seeking an intelligent, resourceful, and proactive young woman to join the team as an Executive Secretary to directly support the Managing Director (MD).
	The ideal candidate will be highly organized, detail-oriented, and capable of handling a wide variety of administrative tasks in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide high-level administrative support to the Managing Director.
	Organize and schedule meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements for the MD.
	Draft, review, and send communications on behalf of the MD.
	Prepare and manage reports, presentations, and documents for internal and external meetings.
	Liaise with internal departments and external stakeholders on behalf of the MD.
	Assist in the management of office operations and general administrative functions


Requirements


	Minimum of HND or BSc in Office Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	3-4 years of relevant experience in an executive secretarial role or office management. Previous experience working directly with top executives is a plus.
	Strong proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
	Must be based in Onitsha or willing to relocate.


Salary
N130,000 - N180,000 Monthly. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: info@transtellgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "description": "Accret Experience is a fast-growing African digital marketing agency leading in influencer marketing, content strategy, media buying, media production, and social media management. We connect brands with the right creators and help organisations (including charities and NGOs in the UK and US) tell their stories strategically.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Social Media Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time (On-site)
Start Date: Immediate

About the Role


	We are seeking a creative, data-driven Social Media Executive who can help our clients expand their digital impact, build meaningful communities, and drive growth through smart content execution.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement monthly social media content calendars (Instagram, LinkedIn, Facebook, X, TikTok).
	Manage daily posting, content scheduling, and engagement across platforms.
	Collaborate with content, influencer marketing, and video production teams to create compelling content and campaigns.
	Track performance metrics and generate weekly and monthly social media analytics reports.
	Research industry trends and relevant strategies to stay ahead of market shifts and remain relevant.
	Engage communities through comments, messages, stories, and live interactions.
	Identify creative trends for content repurposing and human-centric storytelling.
	Assist in organising and amplifying campaigns.
	Suggest data-driven ideas for audience growth, lead generation, and campaign optimisation.


Required Skills &amp; Qualifications


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Marketing, Communications, Mass Communication, or related field.
	1&ndash;3 years of experience managing brand social media accounts.
	Strong writing skills with a knack for tone adaptation (professional, friendly, witty).


Perks &amp; Growth Roadmap


	Competitive salary + performance incentives
	Opportunity to work with top African creators and global brands
	Learning and career development support
	Inclusive, growth-driven work culture.


Method of Application&nbsp;

        Accret Experience is a fast-growing African digital marketing agency leading in influencer marketing, content strategy, media buying, media production, and social media management. We connect brands with the right creators and help organisations (including charities and NGOs in the UK and US) tell their stories strategically.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time (On-site)
Start Date: Immediate

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a creative, data-driven Social Media Executive who can help our clients expand their digital impact, build meaningful communities, and drive growth through smart content execution.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement monthly social media content calendars (Instagram, LinkedIn, Facebook, X, TikTok).
	Manage daily posting, content scheduling, and engagement across platforms.
	Collaborate with content, influencer marketing, and video production teams to create compelling content and campaigns.
	Track performance metrics and generate weekly and monthly social media analytics reports.
	Research industry trends and relevant strategies to stay ahead of market shifts and remain relevant.
	Engage communities through comments, messages, stories, and live interactions.
	Identify creative trends for content repurposing and human-centric storytelling.
	Assist in organising and amplifying campaigns.
	Suggest data-driven ideas for audience growth, lead generation, and campaign optimisation.


Required Skills & Qualifications


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Mass Communication, or related field.
	1–3 years of experience managing brand social media accounts.
	Strong writing skills with a knack for tone adaptation (professional, friendly, witty).


Perks & Growth Roadmap


	Competitive salary + performance incentives
	Opportunity to work with top African creators and global brands
	Learning and career development support
	Inclusive, growth-driven work culture.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, Portfolio / Links to: hr@accretexperience.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Human Resources (HR) & Administrative Manager Job at Bave Design Studio




        
    

        
        Bave Design Studio - Our client is a reputable Skincare and Beauty retail brand with both a physical store and a growing online presence. Their focus is to provide high-quality skincare products and an excellent customer experience.

They are recruiting smart, organized, and disciplined candidates who will support people operations, administrative structure, and store operations in the capacity below:

Job Position: Human Resources (HR) & Administrative Manager

Job Location: Ogudu GRA, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time
Reports To: Operations Manager

Role Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The HR & Admin Manager will oversee HR processes, ensure smooth administrative operations, support the Operations Manager, and maintain a professional, well-structured work environment.
	This person must be highly organized, proactive, and able to handle HR compliance, recruitment, staff discipline, and day-to-day administrative tasks.


Key Responsibilities
Human Resources (HR):


	Manage end-to-end recruitment, onboarding, and staff orientation.
	Maintain employee records, performance documentation, and HR files.
	Develop and enforce HR policies, SOPs, and workplace guidelines.
	Handle payroll inputs, attendance tracking, leave management, and timesheets.
	Organize staff training, appraisals, and performance reviews.
	Manage conflict resolution, disciplinary processes, and HR reporting.
	Ensure compliance with labour laws and store policies.


Administration:


	Maintain an organized office environment and ensure smooth administrative flow.
	Manage store documentation, inventory records (in collaboration with Inventory Manager), and daily reports.
	Oversee vendor communication, facility maintenance, and office supplies.
	Support daily store operations (opening checklist, closing checklist, staff scheduling, etc.).
	Assist with purchasing, petty cash tracking, and expense documentation.
	Prepare weekly and monthly admin reports for management.


Operations Support:


	Work directly under the Operations Manager to execute strategic operational plans.
	Help monitor store performance metrics and store productivity.
	Assist with customer service issues that escalate beyond sales staff.
	Ensure staff are following SOPs for in-store and online operations.
	Help coordinate online order processing and documentation when necessary.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications.
	2 - 4 years of experience in HR, Admin Management, or Office Management.
	Experience in a retail or beauty/skincare brand is a strong advantage.
	Strong communication, organization, and documentation skills.
	Proficiency with HR tools.
	Ability to multitask and work under pressure.
	Strong leadership, integrity, and professionalism.
	Ability to work well with staff and support management.


Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the next stage of the interview.
